snippet: Jacob C. England and Alvin Watts are accused of shooting five African-Americans in north Tulsa on Friday. Three black people were killed, and two others were wounded in the attacks.
abstract: Police in Tulsa, Okla, arrest Jacob C England and his roommate Alvin Watts, charging that they shot and killed three black people and wounded two others while driving around the city's northern district; arrests follow an intense manhunt intended to quell widespread terror in Tulsa's black community over Easter weekend; investigators have not yet concluded that crimes were racially motivated, but England posted several distressed and racist messages to his Facebook account before the shootings took place.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and CHANNING JOSEPH
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Tulsa, and Channing Joseph from New York.

lead_paragraph: Jacob C. England and Alvin Watts are accused of shooting five African-Americans in north Tulsa on Friday. Three black people were killed, and two others were wounded in the attacks.

headline.seo: Tulsa Police Arrest 2 Men in Shootings
headline.main: Arrests in Shootings End a Terrifying Weekend in Tulsa
headline.print_headline: Police Arrest Two in Shootings, Ending a Terrifying Weekend in Tulsa
